p: Robert Zuber is director of UN-based Global Action to Prevent War and Armed Conflict where he directs a small team of policy advocates and interns monitoring the UN's work on security, gender, sustainable development and human rights policy. He also serves as consultant, adviser or board member to a variety of non-profit and educational organizations, including Green Map System, Global Connections Television, FIACAT (human rights) the Peace Angels Project, and Women in International Security (NY and CA). Based in Harlem, New York and with graduate degrees from Yale and Columbia Universities, he has written and spoken extensively on peacekeeping, Security Council reform, the global arms trade, and related human security and global governance concerns. He has co-organized events in over 30 countries on topics from the impact of trafficked weapons on sustainable development to the role of civil society and women advocates in policy development and peace processes.
